1.text: Choose the right type of fish.

2.text: Find a large cast-iron pot and fire logs for an outdoor boil.

3.text: Select a large stockpot for an indoor boil.

4.text: Salt the water and bring it to a boil.

5.text: Add the seasonings to the water and boil for several minutes.

6.text: Place the fish in the water and boil for 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily.

7.text: Skim the froth and remove the fish.

8.text: Clean the potatoes and peel the onions.

9.text: Combine the potatoes and onions in the stockpot and cover with water.

10.text: Add the salt and bring to a boil.

11.text: Cook the potatoes and onions until the potatoes are nearly tender.

12.text: Add the fish on top of the vegetables.

13.text: Remove the fish from the pot and put on a platter.

14.text: Place the vegetables around the fish and garnish with herbs.

15.text: Serve the fish with melted butter and lemons.
